intro: Tithymalus graminifolius subsp. tommasiniana, commonly known as the Italian tithymale, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe. It features slender, upright stems that bear small, clustered flowers in shades of pink to purple. The leaves are narrow and grass-like, giving it its species name "graminifolius." It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or alpine environments. This subspecies is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
